meanings.definition: A piece of armor originally made of chain mail.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore sturdy hauberks into battle.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed ancient hauberks from the medieval era.
meanings.sent3: The hauberks clanked loudly as the knight tried to sneak up on the dragon.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was his hauberk, protecting him from harm.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the hauberks in the sunlight was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To cover or protect with a hauberk.
meanings.sent1: She hauberks her heart with kindness towards others.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith hauberks the armor for the upcoming tournament.
meanings.sent3: The chef hauberks the delicate souffle with a layer of chocolate.
meanings.sent4: His words hauberks her from the harsh reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The mother's love hauberks her child from the cruelties of the world.
